page.title: 19Famous ghosts of Quinton.
page.content: Some of the best known ghosts are: the toe-pulling ghost,the rolling head,the buried man of 6 acres,the driver on the M5 bridge,the one legged rag and bone man,the scarecrow with a pitchfork,the farmer who breaks legs, thewhite lady on a horse of Woodgate Valley fields,Walter Somers of Mucklow Hill,Tony who flicks switches and Fred of Gorsley Piece who smashes,slams, throws and bounces. The most famous ghost is Tommy Knocker (Tom Presterne) who haunts the bottom corner of Quinton Road West.He gets his name because he hung himself on a tree.Knock the tree 3 times at midnight and he is supposed to answer your call or appear as a ghost.There are more stories to do with him.A man once tried to chop down the tree and on the next day he was found hanging on the tree with an axe in his head.
